steps: Power off laptop completely and unplug power adapter
Remove all screws from bottom panel using Phillips screwdrivers
Use plastic prying tools to carefully separate bottom panel
Disconnect internal battery connector for safety
Ground yourself with anti-static wrist strap
Locate target component for repair or replacement
Disconnect any cables connected to the component
Remove mounting screws securing the component
Install new component ensuring proper seating
Reconnect all cables and secure with screws
Replace bottom panel and all screws
Power on and test all functions
warnings: Always disconnect battery before working on internal components
Use anti-static protection to prevent component damage
Handle RAM and storage devices with extreme care
Ensure replacement parts are compatible with exact model
Overtightening screws can damage plastic mounting points
Keep track of screw locations as they vary in length
Check warranty status before opening device
